items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.05
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Excuse Absence of Board President Eddie Garcia from July 28, 2010 and August 19, 2010, Board Meetings (Education Code Section 35120)
	 
	 
The District has been informed that Board President Eddie Garcia is ill, he required hospitalization, and he was absent from the July 28, 2010, Board meeting and will be absent from the August 19, 2010, Board meeting due to his illness. 
	 
Per Education Code section 35120(c), a Board Member who is absent from a meeting may receive his/her monthly stipend if the Board adopts a resolution finding that the Board member was absent due to illness.
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$675 Board Monthly Stipend
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board resolve and find that Board President Eddie Garcia's absences were due to his illness and that the Board excuse his absence from the July 28, 2010, and August 19, 2010, Board Meetings.
items.item_recommendation: Administration recommends that the Board resolve and find that Board President Eddie Garcia's absences were due to his illness and that the Board excuse his absence from the July 28, 2010, and August 19, 2010, Board Meetings.

items.item_text_raw: 9.05 Excuse Absence of Board President Eddie Garcia from July 28, 2010 and August 19, 2010, Board Meetings (Education Code Section 35120) - Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.06
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Frank Biehl, Board Member
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Community Communication Initiative
	 
	 
	 
I believe that a lot of the good work being completed by our teachers, support staff and administrators goes unreported. I have been impressed with the "Weekly Report" that is prepared by the Interim Superintendent and distributed to Board Members. I suggest that this publication be posted on-line and that an e-mail list be created to circulate the link to the publication weekly. Such an e-mail list should include the press, locally elected and appointed officials, employees, key school site and district volunteers and any other community member with an interest in the success of our students.
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the publication be posted on-line and that an e-mail list be created to circulate the link to the publication weekly. The e-mail list should include the press, locally elected and appointed officials, employees, key school site and district volunteers and any other community member with an interest in the success of our students.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the publication be posted on-line and that an e-mail list be created to circulate the link to the publication weekly. The e-mail list should include the press, locally elected and appointed officials, employees, key school site and district volunteers and any other community member with an interest in the success of our students.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
Item:  10.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:15 p.m. on the Provisions of the Charter School Petitions of: 1) Summit Public School: Rainier Public School;  and, 2) Summit Public School: Tahoma Public School to Consider the Level of Support for Each Petition by Teachers Employed by the District, Other Employees of the District, and Parents
BACKGROUND
	 
Pursuant to Education Code 47605 a public hearing is required within 30 days following the submission of a charter school petition to the district.  The petitions were submitted to the district on June 25, 2010.  When requested by the district, Summit Public School granted the District an extension of time for the required public hearings. 
	 
During the public hearing, the Governing Board of the school district shall consider the level of support for the petition by the teachers employed by the district, other employees of the district and parents.  The governing board shall either grant or deny the charters within 60 days of receipt of the petition; however, the date may be extended by an additional 30 days if both parties agree to the extension.  Such agreement has been reached and at the September 16, 2010, Board Meeting the Governing Board shall make its determination.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
To Be Determined
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
To Be Determined
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Hold public hearing to consider level of support for the petition submitted by Summit Public School: Rainier Public School and Summit Public School: Tahoma Public School.
items.item_recommendation: Hold public hearing to consider level of support for the petitions submitted by Summit Public School: Rainier and Summit Public School: Tahoma.
items.item_text: Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:15 p.m. on the Provisions of the Charter School Petitions of: 1) Summit Public School: Rainier Public School; and, 2) Summit Public School: Tahoma Public School to Consider the Level of Support for Each Petition by Teachers Employed by the District, Other Employees of the District, and Parents - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.07
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
	 
SUBJECT:                     Approve Funding Change in Contracts CCTR 9321 and CSPP 9585 
	 
	 
Change in funding allotment between contract CCTR 9321 and CSPP 9585.  CSPP 9585 is to decrease in allotment and CCRT 9321 will correspondingly increase.  Changes made in contracts to account for fluctuating program population. These amendments are the final contract adjustments for the 2009-2010 school year to maximize our annual program earnings.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
California Department of Education
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Funding Change in Contracts CCTR 9321 and CSPP 9585.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.08
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Robert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional Development/Migrant Education
					 
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Receive the Second Valenzuela/CASHEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaints Quarterly Report for Period Covering April 1 through June 30, 2010 as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727)
	 
	 
Background
As a result of the Williams Case (EC 35186), referred to as a landmark Superior Court case requires that every California public school provide each student with, at the very least, sufficient textbooks and instructional materials; clean, safe and functional buildings and facilities; and permanent, appropriately trained and assigned teachers.  Additionally, under the settlement of the Valenzuela/CASHEE Settlement (EC 37254) students in grades 10 to 12 inclusive shall be notified of services available to students up to two consecutive years after the completion of grade 12 who have not yet passed the CAHSEE.
	 
School districts shall support summarized data on the nature and resolution of all Williams Complaints and Valenzuela/CAHSEE Complaints on a quarterly basis to the governing board and the county superintendent of schools.  The report shall include the number of complaints by the general subject area with the number of resolved and unresolved complaints.
	 
The attached report indicates the number of complaints filed from April 1, 2010 through June 30, 2010.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Senate Bill 6 (Williams)
State Instructional Materials Allocation
District Instructional Materials Budget
Other Categorical funds as Appropriate
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the second Quarterly Valenzuela/CASHEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint report for the period covering April 1, 2010 through June 30, 2010, as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727).
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the second Quarterly Valenzuela/CASHEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint report for the period covering April 1, 2010 through June 30, 2010, as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727).
items.item_text: Receive the Second Valenzuela/CASHEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaints Quarterly Report for Period Covering April 1 through June 30, 2010 as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727) - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Robert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional Development/Migrant Education

TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Jerry Kurr, Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Accept Warrant Register for the Months of June and July 2010
	 
	 
Attached is a list of warrants issued during the months of June and July 2010, in response to Board Policy 3314 Payment for Goods and Services adopted by the Board in May 2009.  The Policy states that, “The Board shall approve all warrants (checks) at a regularly scheduled Board meeting.”  While there is no legal requirement for Board approval of issued warrants, this list and future lists will add to the “transparency” of when the Board approves purchase orders, contracts and other authorized expenses as per Board Policies.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended the Board of Trustees accept the Warrant register for the months of June and July 2010.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  14.02
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Interim Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning, and Dr. Anthony Monreal, 
Latino College Preparatory Academy
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Presentation and Approval of the Plan for Technology at Latino College Preparatory Academy
	 
	 
Under Prop 39 Latino College Preparatory Academy (LCPA) is eligible to participate in the District's Bond Measure E proceeds.  Bond funds may only be used to improve District buildings/properties and/or to provide appropriate equipment.  LCPA located at National Hispanic University, a non-district property, may use Bond proceeds to purchase equipment.  LCPA has identified a severe need for technology to support instruction, students and staff.  LCPA will be presenting their plan to remedy this resource and access deficiency.
	 
Eligible funding to date was calculated as such:  1) $130 million in Bond proceeds have been issued for projects, which is 37% of the Bond authorized for projects over the next 2 - 3 years; 2) $740 per ADA is the amount estimated for charter schools over the life of the Bond Measure; 3) LCPA's realized ADA for 2009-10 is 408 x $740 = $301,920 available over the life of the Bond proceeds; 4) $301,920 x 37% = $111,710 available for LCPA until the next draw of Bond proceeds.
	 
The $740 per ADA is derived by the already established Board authorization for "Technology Equipment" cost allocation under Measure E exclusive of the system-wide network upgrade cost divided by an estimated district-wide student average daily attendance.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
$111,710.00
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Measure E
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended the Board of Trustees approve the base allocation of $740 per one time maximum ADA for high school age District resident students attending charter schools within the District for technology and equipment procurement.  It is also recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the proposed Latino College Preparatory Academy Technology Plan and budgeted amount to proceed with the planning, purchasing and implementing as appropriate.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the base allocation of $740 per one time maximum ADA for high school age District resident students attending charter schools within the District for technology and equipment procurement. It is also recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the proposed Latino College Preparatory Academy Technology Plan and budgeted amount to proceed with the planning, purchasing and implementing as appropriate.
items.item_text: Presentation and Approval of the Plan for Technology at Latino College Preparatory Academy - June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning, and Dr. Anthony Monreal, Latino College Preparatory Academy
items.item_text_raw: 14.02 Presentation and Approval of the Plan for Technology at Latino College Preparatory Academy - June Francis Rono, Ph.D., Director of Facilities and Planning, and Dr. Anthony Monreal, Latino College Preparatory Academy

The attach Request for Proposals (RFP), RFP-09-09-10, for contracts for the purchase of stores warehouse supplies is being present for Board approval.
